data.title: ´Afterglow´, produced by members of TAI, nominated for the Max Awards
data.meta_description: The piece participates in the category of "Best revelation show"
data.text:
The play Afterglow, produced by community members TAI, is a candidate for Max Awards of the Performing Arts, as a recognition of the work of the entire team and the trajectory of the production. The piece, which has been sold out in all its functions in 73 ship throughout the season and in record time, it is on the bill in this space until July 4th.

Afterglow has been developed in its production and artistic direction by members of the community TAI. It has been produced by Diego Rebollo (tiny loves), Institutional manager and Carlos Martín (Coppermade y Moles and Pa'tras), professor at the Faculty of Visual Arts and member of the Quality and Development team.

He counts among his art team with the teachers Lola Barroso (Max Award for Furious Scandinavia) as lighting designer and Bengoa Vázquez (Men who write in small rooms y Mariana Pineda) as set designer and designer. Olga L. Hidalgo, responsible for communication TAIHe is also part of the production team.

The School TAI It also collaborates as a partner, lending some of its resources and supporting the professional creative projects of the Community TAI. In addition, and within its objective of putting students in contact with the industry, School students from different disciplines such as Performing Arts, Cinema or Music carry out internships in the show. The original director and author of Afterglow, S.Asher Gelman and the producer evan bernardin, also came from Broadway to Madrid to see the Spanish adaptation and shared a meeting with the students TAI to share experiences about their work in the performing arts.

In 2021, the Max Awards also celebrate the fourth edition of a very special award, in the one in which the public is in charge of choosing the show that they liked the most of the season. Each voter will be able to vote for the candidate showss (of all modalities) and the one with the highest score will be the final winner. To vote, all you have to do is click. this link. The period to participate will remain open until July 26, 2021. Among all the voters, a trip for two people with tickets to the gala will be raffled, which will take place on October 4 at the Arriaga Theater in Bilbao.

Afterglow arrived in Madrid after his success in off-Broadway and London. The play tells the story of Josh and Alex, a married couple with a stable and open relationship that one night they invite to Darius to share his bed. From there, the three men develop a three-way story in which the viewer becomes a voyeur who will enter his room and his privacy. The limits of desire, trust and fidelity will be put to the test in a work in which both bodies and feelings are stripped naked, while couple models are questioned.

The play is directed in its Spanish version by Pedro Casas (The Mr. Smith Trilogy y katana) and interpreted by the actors Andrés Acevedo (gross indecency y Burundanga), diego rodriguez (Follies, Anastasia) and Jorge Vidal (Burundanga).

Afterglow It premiered in 2017 at the Davenport Theater in New York and in 2019 it jumped to London to reach Madrid, with the incredible success it has had this season and, soon, to Los Angeles. All of its adaptations have received applause from critics and the public for their subject matter and risky staging, and it has become one of the international theatrical hits.
